text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen I haven't 
made fried rice for quite a while on the show so

I thought it's about time I make another one so I 
wanted to use a non Thai vegetable and incorporate

it into a Thai dish so I'm gonna make a chicken 
and kale fried rice you know kale is trendy right

now so I thought I'd better use it before it goes 
out of style so let's get started so I am using

chicken because it was in my fridge so you can use 
whatever protein that you have I'm using chicken

breast today just cut up into small bite-sized 
pieces that's the thing about fried rice you don't

want big honking pieces you want everything to be 
able to fit on your spoon we have to flavor our

chicken because I find when people make fried rice 
and stir fries the chicken or whatever protein

sometimes gets underappreciated and they don't get 
the seasoning they deserve so I'm just putting in

a little bit of golden Mountain sauce which is 
just a different kind of soy sauce you can just

use soy sauce if you'd like and I'm also going 
to add a little bit of sugar you won't taste the

sweetness but your chicken will just taste that 
much better all right let's look at the kale so

I'm using lacinato kale today and of course you 
can use other kinds of kale as well I just like

last night okay because the Leafs are flat and 
it's so much easier to clean I want to separate

the leaf and the stem because the stem will take 
a little longer to cook whereas the leaf will be

very quickly so I want to throw the leaves in 
just at the end there you go so you want to add

a little spiciness to this and you can of course 
just add chili flakes of fresh chilies but what

I did was I took two dried chilies I removed the 
seeds so that way it can add more of the chilies

without the heat and then I just chopped it up and 
there's my homemade reduced heat chili flakes now

the sauce soy sauce now this is Thai soy sauce but 
you can use other kinds of soy sauce not a problem

equal parts fish sauce I love fish sauce and fried 
rice and you can of course do oyster sauce instead

but I there's something about fish sauce and fried 
rice it just makes it Thai I also have some black

soy sauce which I'm not going to add right now I'm 
going to edit later as I am cooking so that I can

control how dark I want it to be and I think I 
am ready to cook I've got my wok here a little

bit of oil and my little trick with fried rice 
is I always cook the protein separately and that

way I can control exactly how done my chicken is 
so I'm not at the mercy of all was the rice done

and then I overcooked my chicken and all that 
whole deal I'm going to go in with the chicken

spread that out give it sometimes a spear get a 
little bit of browning and browning means flavor

that's why we want to do that and the sugar that 
we added also is going to help the chicken brown

a little bit more so I'm checking to see I've got 
some browning going on now I'm going to toss it

I'm just going to cook this until the chicken is 
done and this way I'm also flavouring the pan with

all that caramelization on the chicken so that 
will flavor the right smells good turn this off

remove the chicken put it into a bowl now is when 
the fun really begins going to add a little more

oil and then as with all stir fries you want to 
start out with your aromatics and our aromatics

in this case is onion garlic and the chili flakes 
so what's happening now is not only are we cooking

the vegetables we are allowing the vegetables and 
the chilies to distribute their flavors into the

oil and the oil will then go and flavor everything 
else and I'm going to add the kale stems give it

a chance to cook and I love how the vegetables 
are picking up all the caramelization left by

the chicken that's how this works all right I'm 
putting two eggs now when it comes to fried rice

I do about one egg per person so this is for two 
I'm putting two eggs don't rush it I'm going to

break the yolk I want to give it a little time to 
set before I scramble if I scramble too quickly

it'll just become annihilated and then I want 
you know little pieces of egg rather than just

egg mush all over the place okay so that's good 
that's about halfway I'm going to give it a quick

scramble yeah this about you know 75% said I'm 
going to add my rice now in my pineapple fried

rice video I had a whole tutorial on how to make 
good rice for fried rice but basically you don't

want to add too much water one part rice one part 
water is about perfect and if you can give it a

chance to cool down in the fridge so that it'll 
separate nicely like it is doing for me here

this rice has actually been made two days ago 
I stole it from Adam my cameraman and the sauce

the liquid from the sauce will actually help the 
rice separate a little bit so the action here is

you want to use the back of your spatula to press 
down on any lumps that you see a little bit of

sweetness a little bit of sugar again you won't 
taste sweetness necessarily but what you taste

is the well-balanced saltiness and that's why I 
food is so good it's so addictive because you've

got just the perfect combo of salty and just a 
hint of sweetness okay now I'm going to add my

secret sauce not-so-secret my black soy sauce is 
not very salty it's actually got some molasses

in it so it's got that nice rich molasses flavor 
but what it does do is add a little color you can

also substitute other kinds of dark soy sauce ooh 
almost that so now most of my rice is separated I

don't have any clumps of white rice anywhere I'm 
going to add my kale leaves some what should be a

white pepper but I forgot my wife pepper so we're 
gonna go with black pepper give that a toss give

the kale some time to wilt and then I'm going 
to add my chicken back in and yes pour all that

liquid that's collected in the chicken Bowl back 
in that's all flavor and it'll get absorbed by the

rice and that is it your fried rice is done now 
I got the idea for this dish from a traditional

Thai fried rice called Khao pad cannot vacuum and 
it's basically fried rice with Chinese broccoli

and salted fish now salted fish is hard to find 
here so I just use chicken with a salty marinade

and instead of Chinese broccoli I'm using kale 
but that's where the inspiration sort of came

from and there's something about fried rice in 
a bowl it's just so homey and cozy looking now

when you go to Thailand you're going to see a lot 
of times they serve you a piece of lime with your

fried rice use okay that is not garnish it's going 
to be that bright citrusy lift really adds a touch

of freshness for extra freshness I'm also going to 
do some chopped cilantro on top and trust me this

makes a big difference because right now we don't 
have anything fresh in this fried rice everything

is cooked so that is going to be the cherry on 
the fried rice sundae squeeze a lime always I'm

so hungry this is very exciting this to me has the 
flavor of one of those streetside hole-in-the-wall

places that serve up simple goodness like 
this fried rice here it's salty spicy but well

balanced by that little touch of sweetness that 
we added and that squeeze a lime really freshens

everything up I hope you give this a try I mean 
this is weeknight dinner material right here so

easy so fast and guaranteed everybody in your 
family is gonna love it and if they don't write

me I'll talk to them as always the recipes on hot 
Thai kitchen comm send me a photo when you make

it Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious Thai meal
Oh
